discussion.p: It is not possible to use the two-argument overload of ranges::distance() to compute the distance between a move-only counted_iterator and the default_sentinel. In other words, the following is invalid

blockquote.pre: // iter is a counted_iterator with an move-only underlying iterator ranges::distance(iter, default_sentinel);

discussion.p:
is valid.
Suggested resolution:
For the case where S models sized_sentinel_for<remove_reference_t<I>>, define a constrained overload of ranges::distance(I, S) that takes its iterator argument by const reference instead of by value (and returns last - first as before).

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4849.

blockquote.pre: template<input_or_output_iterator I, sentinel_for<I> S> constexpr iter_difference_t<I> ranges::distance(I first, S last);

blockquote.p:
-1- Preconditions: [first, last) denotes a range, or [last, first) denotes a range and S and I model same_as<S, I> && sized_sentinel_for<S, I>.
-2- Effects: If S and I model sized_sentinel_for<S, I>, returns (last - first); otherwise, returns the number of increments needed to get from first to last.

pre.ins: template<input_or_output_iterator I, sized_sentinel_for<remove_reference_t<I>> S> constexpr iter_difference_t<remove_reference_t<I>> ranges::distance(const I& first, S last);

p.ins: -?- Preconditions: [first, last) denotes a range and S and I model sized_sentinel_for<S, remove_reference_t<I>>.
